page.title: 04DAIRY; CHEWTON MENDIP
page.content: Pullins Dairy is one of the largest businesses situated in this part of the Mendips. Milk is collected daily from farms in Litton, Chewton Mendip and Farrington Gurney. When the milk arrives at the dairy it is pumped into bulk storage tanks, holding up to a total of 7000 gallons. The milk is pasteurised at the rate of 1000 gallons per hour and then passes on to the boiling stage. The bottles are filled at the rate of 150 per minute. Filling is done by means of a vacuum which sucks out all the air inside the bottles. The milk is then loaded on to lorries and floats and delivered to surrounding villages and towns as far afield as Glastonbury and Midsomer Norton.
